title: Publications
text:
Keep this page up to date with working papers, conference presentations, and peer-reviewed publications.






Updating the list




Edit publications/_data/publications.md to add or remove entries.
Use numbered lists for an automatically ordered bibliography.
Add badges or links (e.g., DOI, code, slides) directly in Markdown.




Author, A., & Collaborator, B. (2024). Title of the article. Journal Name, 12(3), 123-145. https://doi.org/xx.xxxx/xxxxx

title: Adam Hardaker
text:
What I’m Working On

Projects & prototypes — snapshots of ongoing AI experiments, data tooling, and collaborative builds.
Publications — working papers, conference talks, and peer-reviewed articles.
CV — full academic and professional history.







Ideas for future additions




A short “Research agenda” overview to give visitors context for upcoming work.
Optional blog highlights or newsletter signup once you decide on a writing workflow.
A media or talks section with recordings, slides, or interviews.

title: Projects
text:
Here you can keep track of the experiments, prototypes, and side projects that don’t quite fit into a formal publication yet.






Adding a new project




Duplicate _template.qmd in projects/entries/ and give it a descriptive name.
Update the YAML header with the project title, optional thumbnail, and publication date.
Write a short summary in Markdown. You can embed code blocks, images, or external links as needed.



The listing below will automatically update whenever you add a new .qmd file to projects/entries/.








No matching items
